intro: Sempervivum × verlotii, commonly known as the Chocolate Plant, is a hybrid succulent species native to the Pyrenees region. It features dense, rosette-shaped foliage with thick, fleshy leaves that range in color from green to deep purple or reddish-brown. The plant produces vibrant red or orange flowers on tall, erect stems during the summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Sempervivum × verlotii is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative houseplant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
